What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: This course gave me a very detailed method by which I can approach learning new repertoire. I learned six pieces myself, and heard much more about the history of folk songs (my semester's theme). I also learned a lot of technique from listening to other students workshop their pieces, and tried to speak Hungarian on top of it all!
I learned more about how to healthily sing and how to sing in other languages.
Singing skills in a classical sense
I learned how to study, learn, and perform art song literature. I learned about folk song tradition in vocal music. I also furthered my skills in learning German and Hungarian.
I learned a bit about music theory and a bit about different dialects, but almost nothing about singing or performing.
Not much. This course is mostly listening to recordings, other singers, and how to pronounce a few words of a different language for a song.

Professor Lalli is a great vocal coach and an enthusiastic teacher. The repertoire, both available and suggested, was an incredible selection, and such a treat to sing. The one weakness in the course is the amount of time listening to other students, but with this design of the class, very little can be done about it.

This course gives great personal feedback and helps us learn to conquer any stage fright by making us sing in front of the class every week. However, the class itself can get a little boring while everyone else is singing, especially because it is a two hour class. However, it is worth it for the vocal improvement!
I think this course is great because of the performance opportunities. However, it is pretty demanding because of the rate at which music needs to be learned.
The course did not focus on performance or on vocal technique whatsoever; it was a lot more centered around memorizing songs and mastering different dialects.

Strengths are: the talent of all the people in the room and the type of music that we study. Weaknesses: lack of technical training, practicality of learning to pronounce a few words is low. There was a lot of busy work and what felt like arbitrary memorization.

Take it! Professor Lalli is such fun to work with, and the repertoire he makes available is really incredible. You'll learn so much from the semester, in singing technique and in odd facts or histories of your pieces. If you learn music easily, the class isn't too much work; if you don't, it takes time but can still be wonderful.
No. In my opinion, the professor was catty and he rarely helped us directly.

Yes! Take this class! It is a little strange in how it is organized but it is so amazing working with Lalli and Sara and you will grow so much so fast as a singer, even if you've never sung classically before.

I do not recommend this class to another student. Some people take this class more than once, and I really dont understand why. The class is overall excessively demanding and expects an unfair amount from non-classical singers. The feedback is poor and the grading is harsh. At least one student this semester dropped this class.
Yes, it was a relatively interesting course with a very nice professor who clearly cared.
If you want to be a better singer, definitely take this course. It will make a better and more intelligent performer.
No. The course was about busywork.
No. It was fun at times but I didn't feel that I learned very much or acquired any useful skills.
